Key Match Events: Morten Hjulmand scored a fantastic strike from 25 yards to equalize the game.
Phil Foden hit the post with a low effort from 25 yards out.
Andreas Christensen had a great chance to win the game but half-volleys over the bar from six yards.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg nearly won the game with a curling shot that hit the post.
Pre-Game Insights: Southgate admitted that England need improvement after the draw.
England secured an early goal but lacked purpose and pressure in possession.
Denmark outplayed England and had the easier task to come forward and attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Stones not worried by England's draw with Denmark, stating there are still positives to take from the game.
England may top the group but questions remain about their credentials as tournament contenders.
Southgate expressed frustration with the lack of pressure on Denmark in possession and cohesion between the lines.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England missed the opportunity to secure their passage to the second round of Euro 2024 with a 1-1 draw against Denmark.
Denmark's performance warranted a win according to the article.
The game mirrored England's previous performance against Scotland three years ago.
